headline: Berry Overnight Oats
description: Prep these fruity, creamy oats the night before and in the morning you've got a quick, fresh breakfast.
name: Berry Overnight Oats
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup Quaker® Oats (Quick or Old Fashioned, uncooked)
1 cup fresh mixed berries and fruit

recipeInstructions.text: Add Quaker® Oats to your container of choice and pour in milk.
Layer Greek yogurt, chia seeds and mixed fruit and berries.
Refrigerate overnight and enjoy in the morning!

review.reviewBody: added a little bit of maple syrup in the morning - just because
It was very bland. Definitely healthy though! I don't recommend adding raspberries as the fruit in-between. I think with a few tweaks it could be better, such as if you added honey or sweetener.
I have 6 oz mason jars, so I also used 1/4 c. I also used coconut milk and pie spice. Delicious!

My daughter loves this. I double or triple the servings in a large container with a lid. First I mash a half a banana per serving then add remaining ingredients. I use 2 teaspoons chia seeds per serving, 2 teaspoons of maple syrup, and craisins or blueberries. I sprinkle cinnamon and dash of vanilla extract. Before serving, I add crushed walnuts or pecans.
Made it exactly as is. It was delicious however too much for me to eat in one sitting. Next time I’ll try making the recipe in half.
Super-easy and super-yummy! Perfect for my kids' Valentine's Day breakfast!

This was my first time making overnight oats. I used frozen blueberries for the fruit, coconut milk instead of regular milk, and coconut yogurt. They turned out great and most importantly, the kids loved it!!
Only thing I added was a teaspoon of honey to give it a little sweetness.

This is so easy and tasted fantastic! When I bring it to work and put it in the fridge, my co workers are always admiring how pretty and delicious it it looks and a few have jumped on the band wagon. I substituted frozen organic berries for the fresh fruit and just 1/4 cup coconut milk instead of the 1/2 milk it calls for in the recipe.
Used vanilla non Greek yoart and raise s. Want to try different flavors and dried fruit.
so good and so so so soooooo easy to make!
So GOOD and SATISFYING! I did add a little bit of Honey.
I added 1 teaspoon of honey and a dash of cinnamon and added finely chopped strawberries and used almond milk instead of regular milk.
Very easy and delicious! I didn’t have vanilla yogurt so I used strawberry instead - yum! Also, I didn’t have jars to use so my plastic container did the trick. I will definitely be doing this again.

I still like the idea of hot oatmeal so I often will microwave the oatmeal for 2 minutes after it sat in the fridge overnight. I put the oats in one of my soup cups with a handle and eat on my 45 minute commute to work. 
If you're going to microwave it, add a splash (maybe 2 tbsp worth) of milk after refrigerating overnight and before putting it in the microwave or else you will dry out the oats.
I also add 1 Tbsp of the powder PB fit for flavor.

I had made Signature Sweet 'N Low Pink Lemonade from this site and had 1 cup of thawed strawberries left over, so I decided to make this recipe. I used almond milk and added some stevia for sweetness. Great morning oatmeal with very little effort.
love it!!! So filling and tasty! I also add 1/2 tsp of chia seeds for a protein boost and 1/2 tsp agave nectar for sweetness!
So easy & delicious! I had 6oz jars so each ingredient was 1/4 cup. I also used vanilla yogurt & flaxseed.
